New Records: Glenn Phillips became the first batter to score a century in World Cups while coming in to bat in the middle order.
Glenn Phillips joins former Kiwi skipper Brendon McCullum as the only two New Zealanders to hit a T20 World Cup hundred.
Key Match Events: Glenn Phillips scored a century at the Sydney Cricket Ground.
Phillips completed his century in just 61 balls, smashing 10 boundaries and 4 sixes.
Phillips' knock helped New Zealand register 167/7 on the board after 20 overs against Sri Lanka.
